column4: Hi. I just tried to do a fresh install of Hardy on my computer. I have two drives and two optical drives on my motherboards IDE controller, and three more hard drives on my Silicon Image-based PCI-IDE card. It is detecting the Sil-card's drive first(hda, hdb, and hdc). After the install, all I get is a screen full of "﻿GRUB ﻿GRUB ﻿GRUB ﻿GRUB ﻿GRUB ﻿GRUB ..." What can I do to fix this?
did the install complete?
Yes, finished fine and I clicked restart.
In Gutsy, my onboard IDE drives were hda and hdb. Now they are all sdX
thats normal.thats a libata change
are any of the drives reporting themselves wrong to the bios?
i know there are issues with sata drives that tell the bios to pretende they're IDE
Nope, I watched them all pop up, they seem to be going in just fine. Oh, and also, they are IDE drives, not SATA
theyre *all* IDE? all more than 5?
Yes, I have five IDE hard drives.
you cant do that
i dont know how else to explain it but...5 IDEs just cant go
its a bug
Uh, yeah I can. I have two connect on the motherboard's IDE controller, and three on a PCI expansion card.
on ubuntu, 5 IDEs just cant go
It was working just fine in Gutsy
regression....its a known bug on hardy though
and in hardy it is a problem.  things changed and it got broken.  thats all there is to it
hopefully itll be fixed by 8.04.1 in june, but maybe it wont
stick to gutsy

I still think this is a grub and/or devmapping issue. I had this problem once before in Edgy or whenever they changed up the ATA a while back, and fixed it by installing Ubuntu on a drive on the PCI controller and it worked flawlessly. I guess I'll just have to scramble my drives and do it that way again... annoying as it is. >_>
